intro: Homalium travancoricum, commonly known as the Travancore homalium, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Salicaceae and is characterized by its deciduous nature, shedding its leaves during the dry season. The plant features compound leaves with serrated margins and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense evergreen forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
